title: Pride of Britain Awards: Love Island's India Reynolds discusses her 'difficult' split with Ovie Soko
text:
Their relationship recently came to an 'amicable' end amid conflicting schedules.

And India Reynolds discussed her 'difficult' split from boyfriend Ovie Soko as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening.

The Love Island beauty, 28, stunned in a burgundy off-the-shoulder gown as she narrowly avoided an awkward run-in with her ex, also 28, on the red carpet.

Elegant: India Reynolds stunned in a burgundy off-the-shoulder gown as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening

Putting on a brave face, the model wowed in the form-fitting, long-sleeved number, which she paired with a simple pair of black heels.

India's raven locks cascaded over her shoulders in bouncy curls, while she added a glam palette of make-up to her face.

She accessorised her classy look with a simple gold necklace, a gold watch and an ornate poppy pin.

And while India was winning in the style stakes, the same couldn't be said for her love life as she opened up on her break-up with the basketball player.

Close call: The Love Island beauty, 28, narrowly avoided an awkward run-in with her ex, also 28, on the red carpet

Glam: Putting on a brave face, the model wowed in the form-fitting, long-sleeved number, which she paired with a simple pair of black heels

Speaking about the split on the red carpet, she said: 'Obviously it’s difficult, but any break-up is difficult. It’s even more difficult when it’s in from of the rest of the world, but I’ll be fine.'

Stating that she had the support of her pals, she continued: 'I’m lucky I’ve got a really close group of girlfriends, they’ve been really looking after me.'

When asked whether her DMs were full now she's single again, India laughed: 'Maybe they’ll be a bit more full now!'

However, the beauty, who reached the final three of Love Island 2019 with Ovie, felt a little hesitant after being single again for the first time in months.

Gorgeous: India's raven locks cascaded over her shoulders in bouncy curls, while she added a glam palette of make-up to her face

She said: 'I feel like I’ve been dropped back in the ocean. We’ll see.'

While India dazzled on the red carpet and gave an update into her romance woes, her ex Ovie was also at the event, but avoided posing for snaps and thus avoided India too.

He did however find time to greet his fans as his Instagram stories show him signing dozens of autographs.

Meanwhile, the sportsman was also seen enjoying the night with his Love Island pal Amber Gill, who he sat next to at the event.

Their attendance comes after a source has told MailOnline that India and Ovie came to an 'amicable' decision to end their brief romance due to conflicting schedules.

Tough: Obviously it’s difficult, but any break-up is difficult. It’s even more difficult when it’s in from of the rest of the world, but I’ll be fine'

The former lovebirds were thought to be on the rocks over the last few weeks after having rarely been seen together following heavy cheating speculation on both ends.

The couple finished third on Love Island in July, after striking up a romance just weeks before the series came to an end.

Just days ago, rumours surfaced claiming Ovie had got close to Maya Jama however he hit back at the claims.

He said: 'You know what’s joke? I’ve never met Maya. I’ve never met her in my life. I swear to God, I’ve never met her in my life...

Moving on? When asked whether her DMs were full now she's single again, India laughed: 'Maybe they’ll be a bit more full now!'

Hey guys: Ovie avoided an awkward run-in with his ex as he skipped the red carpet pictures and signed autographs for fans instead

'They did filming for the very last [Love Island spin-off] Aftersun, which was at the villa, where she was there with two other talents and the whole cast we’d sort of shot... I think it was like a promo.

'You know she was standing outside a door but, no. Never met her in my life.'

Last month Ovie was forced to hit back at claims that India had cheated on him with footballer Kieran Gibbs, 29, at his birthday party in Ibiza.

In an exclusive interview with MailOnline the basketball player said: 'Me and India are happy. I think that's definitely the most important thing. We're very happy.

'Regardless of how many people [there are] in every one of our lives, there will be opinions. And everyone can have their own opinion.'

Fun night: Meanwhile, the sportsman was also seen enjoying the night with his Love Island pal Amber Gill, who he sat next to at the event

All over: The former lovebirds were thought to be on the rocks over the last few weeks after having rarely been seen together following heavy cheating speculation on both ends

Speaking of the cheating claims, India added to MailOnline: 'We've had a week of nightmare things. There was one [rumour] last week and then yesterday there was another. Can we have a break? Can we just live, please?

'We've been absolutely fine, but obviously it's not nice. The worst thing is – something coming out in the paper is one thing, we know it's not true and we can just get over that – but it's all the people on Instagram that start sending you horrible messages.'

Clarifying the situation, she explained: ‘I’ve known Kieran and his brother for years and it was their 30th birthday so I was there with loads of friends and family. There’s nothing about it! It got blown into a ridiculous thing.’

Maura Higgins and Curtis Pritchard, as well as Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, are the only remaining couples from this year's Love Island.
description: The Love Island beauty, 28, stunned in a burgundy off-the-shoulder gown as she discussed her 'difficult' split from boyfriend Ovie Soko at the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday.
